hints.content: To divide a shape in thirds, we divide the whole into **$3$ equal parts**.

This square is divided into $3$ pieces, but the pieces are not  equal in size:  

![A square with 2 angled lines across opposite corners dividing it into 3 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e236e9d6a8729d65f0d6bfb0da344fad9f6f34eb)

This square is divided into $4$ parts:  

![A square has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5d4417e3fe5b2989e17379ffaa85967a59acca77)

These squares are divided into thirds:  

![A square has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/16c953771bc77af1c6db64966cdb81249de8509e)
![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/02531151eddafc9cd09e446727a47712892ad336)

question.content:
**Which squares are divided into thirds?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A square has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/16c953771bc77af1c6db64966cdb81249de8509e)
![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/02531151eddafc9cd09e446727a47712892ad336)
![A square has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5d4417e3fe5b2989e17379ffaa85967a59acca77)
![A square with 2 angled lines across opposite corners dividing it into 3 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e236e9d6a8729d65f0d6bfb0da344fad9f6f34eb)
